CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 6, 1959, pg. 6, 7, reads: "'A Home Show Named Success' must be the appropriate label tagged to the ninth annual Courier Home Service Fair, held at the massive Syria Mosque, last Tuesday, Wednesday and Thursday nights. This will be the most talked about 'Fair' ever.  From the opening night when thousands began to gather at the doors, to the final session, when the laughter of prize winners waved emotionally with the disappointed non-winners, the exhibitors and participants worked enthusiastically from their national and local booths to accommodate the happy homemakers.  Beautifully decorated booths, sweet organ music augmented by the 'rock 'em, sock 'em' jazz of Sarah McLawler's combo, set the mood for the huge audiences... (6) The Dan-Dee Potato Chips and Pretzels booth has a Western decor.  Complete Western tags were worn the first two nights by Orie Lee English and her assistant... - Harris Photos."
TitMainTitle: Orie Lee English and another woman in Dan-Dee potato chips and pretzel booth, with cow skull and other western decor, at 1959 Pittsburgh Courier Home Service Fair, Syria Mosque
CatSubject_tab: Women--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Food industry and trade--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Advertising--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Pittsburgh Courier Home Service Fair.Syria Mosque (Pittsburgh, Pa.)

cutline: 'A Home Show Named Success' must be the appropriate label tagged to the ninth annual Courier Home Service Fair, held at the massive Syria Mosque, last Tuesday, Wednesday and Thursday nights. This will be the most talked about 'Fair' ever.  From the opening night when thousands began to gather at the doors, to the final session, when the laughter of prize winners waved emotionally with the disappointed non-winners, the exhibitors and participants worked enthusiastically from their national and local booths to accommodate the happy homemakers.  Beautifully decorated booths, sweet organ music augmented by the 'rock 'em, sock 'em' jazz of Sarah McLawler's combo, set the mood for the huge audiences... (6) The Dan-Dee Potato Chips and Pretzels booth has a Western decor.  Complete Western tags were worn the first two nights by Orie Lee English and her assistant... - Harris Photos.
